meanings.definition: People who make a loud and confused noise.
meanings.sent1: The clamorers outside the stadium were shouting and cheering.
meanings.sent2: The clamorers at the protest demanded to be heard.
meanings.sent3: The group of clamorers outside the library were arguing over the best book to read.
meanings.sent4: The clamorers in the market created a chaotic symphony of sounds.
meanings.sent5: The clamorers in the classroom made it hard to concentrate on the lesson.

meanings.definition: Those who demand something loudly or insistently.
meanings.sent1: The clamorers at the town hall meeting wanted their voices to be heard.
meanings.sent2: The clamorers for justice rallied outside the courthouse.
meanings.sent3: The clamorers for more pizza were getting impatient in the queue.
meanings.sent4: The clamorers for change were not going to stay silent any longer.
meanings.sent5: The clamorers for attention made sure everyone knew their opinions.
